article_title: The Orwellian Route From Free Speech to Unfree Speech — Letters to the Editor
article_text: Sol Stern's "The Unfree Speech Movement" (op-ed, Sept. 24) about Berkeley reads like George Orwell's "Animal Farm." What the honored speakers celebrate this year at Cal isn't their respect for intellectual values on American campuses, but the 50th anniversary of their successful takeover of the academia. "Tenured radicals," such as Bettina Aptheker, celebrate their discovery that when you control the voice of the people, as they managed to do during the 1964-65 protests, you can start masquerading as...
